My son who has been going to Canada with us the past 7 years and is now 20,got a ticket for minor consumption of beer last month. Does anyone know if this will be a problem when going through Customs this year. Thanks for any info.

I am not 100% sure on this one, but I do not believe it would be a problem. The basis for non-admission is if it's a felony in Canada. Minor consumption is not a felony, DWI is a felony in Canada. He should be ok going through. Have a good trip! Agate

What kind of punk cop charges a 20 year old for minor consumption??? Honestly, unless he was streaking naked and screaming through a quiet neighbourhood at 2 in the morning, or something else bizarre (where the consumption would be classified as far greater than 'minor'), that is just 'bad form' on the part of the cop. I don't know the rule or lack thereof, but I can almost guarantee you won't have a problem. Besides, he was charged for something that is legal up here! The best thing is, once he gets here he can drink as much as he wants. NWO Fishing Bum

Redtail - we were in the same position last year. My 19 year old had gotten an underage drinking ticket while at college. Everything I found, and everyone I talked to in Customs, assured me that it wasn't a problem, since it wasn't a DWI.
